intro: Gnaphalium johnstonii, commonly known as Johnston's everlasting, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces a fine, white, powdery coating on its stems and leaves, which is composed of tiny, hair-like structures called trichomes. It thrives in coastal and rocky habitats, often growing in well-drained soils. Due to its delicate appearance and unique botanical features, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
